input.name: __VIEWSTATE

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: As you have probably heard by now, Governor DeWine announced yesterday that he has closed school buildings for the remainder of the year.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: I hope you are staying healthy and that you enjoyed the holiday with your families. Today, I want to share information on voting absentee, free wi-fi access within the district, and remote learning grading.

div.span: Based on family feedback during the first week of remote learning, as well as the governor’s extension of the school building closure period until at least May 1, we are revising our technology plan for chromebook distribution.
Please find attached a letter to our BWHS Class of 2020 regarding prom and graduation. This letter is on Schoology, Facebook, and will be sent in a text/email blast to senior families.
Attention all seniors - we would like to honor you on our social media!

span.span: The move to remote learning has included some technology issues for several of us. Some are struggling with reliable internet access at home, and Schoology has been overloaded at certain times, making it difficult to access assignments.

h3.span: District Mental Health Brief - Family Friday 4.3.20

div.span: This week's Family Friday article by our Mental Health Specialist, Justin Plummer, discusses setting a schedule.

h3.span: District Mental Health Brief - Wellness Wednesday 4.1.20

span.style: color: #272727; font-family: futura-pt, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff

a.style: background-color: #ffffff; cursor: pointer; color: #005696; font-family: futura-pt, sans-serif; font-size: 16px

span.style: color: #272727; font-family: futura-pt, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff
color: #272727; font-family: futura-pt, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: article by Justin Plummer, our Mental Health Specialist, discusses coping with change.

div.span: This week's Mental Health Monday article by Justin Plummer, our Mental Health Specialist, discusses managing stress in changing times.

Thank you for your patience today as many districts across the nation accessed Schoology in unprecedented numbers. Their team is working diligently to continue to increase capacity as we all adjust to this new normal. When all else fails, have your child read, read, read.

I hope you are having a great-- albeit unconventional-- spring break. I have lots of news today, including how House Bill 197, which was just signed into law yesterday afternoon by Governor DeWine, will impact our students.
In reviewing our technology plan for chromebook repairs, we have determined that we will be able to offer hardware repairs at our central office as needed.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Due to the Governor’s “stay-at-home order” being announced today, our district technology department will be working from home beginning this Tuesday until at least April 6.

As we continue to adapt to this situation, I want to update you on our technology support. As you have probably learned in communication from principals and staff, we will rely on some technology and internet access for students during this remote learning period.
As we continue to adapt to this situation, I want to thank the many community volunteers and our awesome food service crew for packing up food for our families in need.

div.span: I wanted to reach out with some updates and clarifications for you. I apologize for the length, but I have lots of information to share.

span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 14.6667px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: While we had initially planned to use this coming Monday, the last day we are permitted to be open, as a last opportunity for staff to meet with students to provide resources and directions for remote learning, we will now be closed to students on Monday.

div.span: The following message is an all call sent on March 13, 2020.

h3.span: Helping Families in Need During Building Closures

div.span: We have gotten lots of questions about how we will help our families in need with meals during the building closures. These details are still being finalized, but we will share soon.

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: "Sgy Open Sans", "Lucida Grande", Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: Good morning, I have received a few questions about the potential of making up time in the summer.

Big Walnut now has a "Digital Backpack" to streamline communication and to help students stay organized. Schoology provides a centralized place for teachers, students, and parents to communicate, access assignments, and receive school and class updates.

div.span: The following is an update that was sent as an all call to families on 03/12/2020.
The following is an all call regarding an update going out to families this evening (3.10.2020)
The attached letter contains an update on the district's efforts to ensure the health and safety of all students.

span.br: We have created “A Guide to Remote Learning” for each level that will get posted to Schoology and social media each Friday.
Big Walnut now has a "Digital Backpack" to streamline communication and to help students stay organized.
